title: mikane_sebiri
body:
[[Original]] character by [[Kani Biimu]]. She was born in his Nicolive broadcasting. Her name, a wordplay for "to cadge money", came from this pose: post #1300645. She has [[brown eyes]], [[pink hair]] with [[two side up]] and [[hair bobbles]]. She wears a [[kindergarten uniform]].

Some jokingly say that she is the main character of this fictional light novel series: "5sai-ji da kedo Kane sae Areba Kankei Nai yo ne!" (lit. As Long as There's Money, It Doesn't Matter If She is a Five-Year-Old Girl, Right?), abbreviated as Saikane.

title: dyurina_asuka
body:
デュリナ・アスカ

[[Original]] character by [[Spacezin]].

JP description:
Ｊ.Ｃ.Ｐに所属し、特殊戦闘部隊副隊長の肩書きを持つ。
特殊戦闘部隊隊長であるギラス・アスカという実兄がいる。
某国大統領の娘だったが、とある事件から兄と共にＪ.Ｃ.Ｐに所属することとなった。

頭脳明晰、容姿端麗、おまけに戦闘能力も高く、男女問わず慕われている。
しかし機械音痴（というより機械に嫌われている）のようで、機械の類は苦手。
あまり外見に気を使わないため、普段は基本的にラフな格好でいることが多い。

title: notre_dame_de_paris
body:
A famous Catholic basilica in [[Paris]] often simply called Notre Dame and built from 1163 to 1345. 

Works referencing the cathedral may also refer to the April 15th, 2019 roof fire that burned for 15 hours and occurred while the cathedral was being renovated and restored. The cathedral is currently slated to reopen in December 2024 at the earliest.

title: kickboxing
body:
Kickboxing is a stand-up combat sports and a form of [[boxing]] based on [[Karate]] and [[Muay Thai]]. The combat takes place in a [[boxing ring]], normally with boxing gloves, mouthguards, shorts, similar with classical boxing sport, albeit the participant were [[barefoot|bare-feeted]] to favor the use of kicks.

While very similar to [[Muay Thai]], Kickboxing can be distinguished by the more "standardized" boxing kits similar to Classical [[Boxing]], and the lack of special Muay Thai techniques that were forbidden in Kickboxing rules such as elbow or knee strike.

She has long blonde hair, [[tsurime]] green eyes, glasses, and small breasts. She usually accompanies [[Arima Senne]], who is her sister. Senka, oddly enough, is the older sister (“because it’s funnier” is the semi-official explanation).

title: electro_emilia
body:
Original character by artist [[Ken (koala)]]. She appears to have been created for an RPG they were playing, but has since become highly popular, and one of this artist's most iconic characters.

While the smaller details of her design are often changed each time she is drawn, there are several constants: long to very long [[white hair]] with [[sidelocks]] and a [[hime cut]], some sort of strange [[headgear]], [[blue eyes]] (sometimes depicted by fan artists as green), a form-hugging black (formerly blue) [[bodysuit]], and a sleeveless blue [[microdress]] with [[neon trim]].

Later, more recent designs include [[panties over pantyhose|panties worn OVER her bodysuit]], [[blue nails]], and [[high heels]] that merge seamlessly with her bodysuit (rather like [[akemi homura|Homura's]] magical girl costume).

[[kicking|Kicks]] seem to be her favored method of attack, and she is frequently depicted as being highly [[flexible]].

h4. See also
* [[Electro Alice]], her rival

title: electro_alice
body:
Electro Alice is an [[original]] character by [[ken (koala)]]. She was introduced as a "rival-type character" of [[Electro Emilia]].

According to the (Google Translated and then more carefully picked apart) "blog post":http://vinyllab.blog23.fc2.com/blog-entry-196.html where she was introduced, there are some differences of note between the two:
* Alice is shorter(?) than Emilia
* Alice is slender where Emilia is curvier
* She has a sadistic personality
* She is not as emotionally mature as Emilia (Or "has a more childlike mindset," possibly)

* "If Emilia's kicks can be thought of as 'a whip or a blow from a (hammered) spike', then Alice's kicks are 'a scythe or the slash from a spear'." (not 100% sure of this)
* "Alice is like Guile, while Emilia is like Chun-Li."

title: horori
body:
"The Fox of Mercy"

A wandering foxkin warrior skilled with a greatsword. Obscenely nice and unfailingly polite, Horori leads an ascetic lifestyle that promotes happiness and love to all. She tries to avoid conflict, but when forced to fight, she maintains a saintlike serenity that masks a fierceness unbound by desires or regret.

[[Original]] character by [[Bad Idea]].

title: ayla_shamalu
body:
"The Violet Oracle".

An Oni-Blooded Tengu who was born into captivity as a slave to the Oni of the Fire Realm, later to be freed by Hanbei. She wears a blindfold to contain the Oni Blood Rage that triggers when she sees blood. She is the first student of Hanbei, wielding dual ring swords with her signature style “Mirage Dancer”, an elusive style that mimics the whimsy and ferocity of the desert winds.

[[Original]] character by [[bad idea]].

title: kida_maraviss
body:
[[Original]] character by [[Bad Idea]].

A Tengu who was banished from her clan for slaying an oni and angering the oni tribes as a result. She is the second student of Twelve Blades Hanbei, wielding twin Iaido [[Sword]]s with her signature style “Sky Cleaver”, a technique known to part the clouds themselves with precision, speed and power.

title: oso-teki_kinoko_gijinka_zukan
body:
A collection of girls who are personified mushrooms by the artist [[oso (toolate)|]]. An artbook/mushroom encyclopedia was released in 2014 titled [i]Oso-teki Kinoko Gijinka Zukan[/i] or [i]oso's Kinoko Personification Pictoral Book[/i], with an update that was released in 2016.  

In late 2016 a 3D CG TV anime adaptation was announced titled [i]Mori no Yousei Kinoko no Musume[/i] (Forest Fairies: [[Mushroom Girl]]s) that aired in early 2017

title: final_fantasy_iv
body:
Fourth JRPG developed by Square Co., Ltd. (now [[Square Enix]]) for the [[Final Fantasy]] series. First Final Fantasy for the SNES, released 19 October 1991. Later released for PlayStation (1997), WonderSwan Color (2001), GameBoy Advance (2005), Nintendo DS (2007) [as a remake], Wii (2009), and mobile phones (2009).

Dark Knight [[Cecil Harvey]] was stripped of his rank as commander of the Red Wings, air force of the Kingdom of Baron, for questioning his mission to invade otherwise peaceful nations in search of the Crystals. Having shed his past to become a Paladin, Cecil and his friends travel the world - and the moon - to stop Baron's march, only to learn of his startling heritage.

title: final_fantasy_v
body:
Fifth JRPG developed by Square Co., Ltd. (now [[Square Enix]]) for the [[Final Fantasy]] series. It was first released on the [[Super Famicom]] on 6 December 1992, and then re-released on the Playstation (1998) and Gameboy Advance (2006).  

Chocobo-riding wanderer [[Bartz Klauser]] sets out across the world with his allies in a desperate race across two worlds to save the Four Crystals from a malevolent warlock trapped in a time-space rift between the two worlds.

title: faris_scherwiz
body:
Playable character in [i][[FINAL FANTASY V]][/i]. Pirate captain bearing a familial bond with [[Syldra]].

When first met, Faris is [[reverse trap|impersonating a male captain]]; "his" true gender is learned by [[Bartz Klauser|Bartz]], [[Galuf Halm Baldesion|Galuf]], and [[Lenna Charlotte Tycoon|Lenna]] accidentally, shortly after Faris joins the party.

Spoiler:
[spoiler]Faris's real name is Sarisa Scherwil Tycoon, and she is Lenna's long-lost elder sister, though neither she nor Lenna are initially aware of this.[/spoiler]

title: axel_in_harlem_(meme)
body:
[b][i]Axel in Harlem[/i][/b] is a short film in 2016 made by Animan Studios. Animan Studios is an adult cartoon studio focused on [[yaoi|gay]], male content that gained virality in 2023 predominantly for the cartoon "Axel in Harlem", which featured a man named Axel walking down a sidewalk while other men were staring at his [[curvy|voluptuous]] rear end. The cartoon was mixed with the song "La Cumbia de Free Fire" by Bukano, specifically the lyrics "Vámonos De Fiesta A Factory"; as well as the song "Ballin'" by DJ Mustard and Roddy Rich, which associates with the video with the lyrics "I Put the New Forgis on the Jeep."

h4. External Links

* "Know Your Meme: Animan Studios/Axel in Harlem":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/animan-studios-axel-in-harlem]

title: ginga_tetsudou_999
body:
[b]Ginga Tetsudou 999[/b], also known as [b]Galaxy Express 999[/b], is an epic and classic [[science fiction]] manga series created and first drawn by [[Matsumoto Leiji]] in 1977. There is a manga version, a TV version, movie versions, and manga sequels (the "Eternal" series).

Matsumoto was inspired to create Galaxy Express 999 by the idea of a steam train running through the stars in the 1934  [[fantasy]] novel [i]Night on the Galactic Railroad[/i] by Miyazawa Kenji.

A little known fact is that the [i]999[/i] in the title of the series is supposed to be pronounced [i]three nine[/i] in English, instead of the [i]nine hundred ninety-nine[/i] or the [i]nine nine nine[/i] most westerners use.

h4.Characters

h6.Main Characters

* [[Hoshino Tetsurou]]
* [[Maetel]]
* [[Conductor (Ginga Tetsudou 999)]] ([i]Shashou-san[/i])

h6.Guest Characters

title: thief_(final_fantasy)
body:
A class in the [[Final Fantasy]] series, which specializes in stealing items and money from enemies. It has many iterations throughout the franchise:

[[Final Fantasy I]]: a job available to the Warriors of Light, which upgrades to the Ninja
[[Final Fantasy III]]: a job acquired from the Fire Crystal
[[Final Fantasy V]]: a job acquired from the Wind Crystal
[[Final Fantasy VI]]: [[Locke Cole]] is one, although jokingly prefers to be called a "treasure hunter"
[[Final Fantasy VII]]: [[Yuffie Kisaragi]] is a Ninja, but is also a Thief by trade
[[Final Fantasy IX]]: considered to be [[Zidane Tribal]]'s primary class
[[Final Fantasy X]]: [[Rikku (ff10)|]]'s initial skills involve stealing and using special items, and mixing them like an Alchemist would
[[Final Fantasy X-2]]: the dressphere class that Rikku wears as her default outfit, although [[Yuna (ff10)|]] and [[Paine (ff10)|]] can also use the class
[[Final Fantasy XI]]: one of the six basic jobs available

title: irem_(black_survival)
body:
A playable character from [[Eternal Return: Black Survival]]. A [[cat girl]] who is forced to participate in Aglaia's experiments on Lumia Island. Along with having [[cat ears]], she can even transform herself into a large [[cat]].

Has [[blonde hair]] and [[heterochromia]], with one [[blue_eyes|blue eye]] and one [[yellow_eyes|yellow eye]].

title: eleven_(black_survival)
body:
A playable character from [[Black Survival]]. A young Chinese streamer born to a rich family who is forced to participate in Aglaia's experiments on Lumia Island. She has an obsession with food.

Has [[pink hair]] and [[pink eyes]]. Her real name is Xia Zixuan.

title: adriana_rivera
body:
A playable character from [[Black Survival]]. An arsonist hailing from Mexico who is forced to participate in Aglaia's experiments on Lumia Island. Due to a childhood incident that resulted in the death of her sister Lily, Adriana is schizophrenic and has an obsession with [[fire]].

Has [[red hair]], [[brown eyes]], and [[medium breasts]]. She's often seen with a [[smoking pipe]].

title: kuruoshiki_oni
body:
[b]Kuruoshiki Oni[/b], or known simply as [b]Oni[/b] is a secret character in [[Street Fighter IV (series)|Super Street Fighter IV: Arcade Edition]]. He is in fact, [[Akuma (street fighter)|]] who has lost control of his power and is now an actual demon instead of a half demon, which confirms that he has transcended humanity.

[b]Note[/b]: This character should not be mistaken as [[Shin Akuma]]. It should be noted, however, that in several pieces of artwork Kuruoshiki Oni is depicted with what appear to be [[glowing]], orange [[beads]] around him.

title: iwakura_lain
body:
The main character of [[serial_experiments_lain|Serial Experiments Lain]].

Lain Iwakura is a 14 year old girl who uncovers her true nature through the series. She is depicted as a shy junior high school student with few friends or interests. Visually, she is characterized by her [[short_hair|short]], [[brown_hair|brown]] and [[asymmetrical hair]] with a [[single sidelock]] which is secured by a [[x hair ornament]]. She is easily identified by her [[camisole]] and her [[bear costume]].

title: body_control
body:
When a [[mind control|mind-controlled]] person can freely think but is otherwise unable to control their body of their own will.

In some cases the controlled character can still talk and control their facial expressions, but not the rest of their body.
In other cases even their speech and expressions are controlled, and the only indication that they are conscious of what's happening is a [[thought bubble]] revealing their true thoughts.

title: sacramento_kings
body:
A professional [[basketball]] team based in Sacramento, [[California]]. They compete in the Western Conference of the [[National Basketball Association]] (NBA) and play their home games at the Golden 1 Center. 

The Kings were founded in 1945 as the Rochester Royals, and have moved several times before settling in Sacramento in 1985. The team has won one NBA championship in 1951 and has produced several notable players over the years, including Oscar Robertson, Chris Webber, and DeMarcus Cousins.

The Sacramento Kings' uniforms primarily feature the colors purple, black, and white. Their home uniforms are white with purple and black accents, while their away uniforms are black with purple and white accents.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Sacramento Kings":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sacramento_Kings]
* "Wikipedia: National Basketball Association (NBA)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Basketball_Association]
other_names: サクラメントキングス

title: los_angeles_lakers
body:
A professional [[basketball]] team based in [[Los Angeles]], [[California]]. They are one of the most successful franchises in the history of the [[National Basketball Association]] (NBA), having won 17 NBA championships, tied with the [[Boston Celtics]] for the most championships won by any team in the NBA. 

The Lakers were founded in 1947 in Minneapolis, Minnesota, and moved to Los Angeles in 1960. The team has had many legendary players throughout its history, including [[Kobe Bryant]], Magic Johnson, Kareem Abdul-Jabbar, [[Shaquille O'Neal]], and Wilt Chamberlain.

The Los Angeles Lakers uniform colors are primarily gold, purple, and white. The home uniform is typically white with gold and purple accents, while the away uniform is typically purple with gold and white accents.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Los Angeles Lakers":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Los_Angeles_Lakers]
* "Wikipedia: National Basketball Association (NBA)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Basketball_Association]

title: fluoroscope
body:
A [b]fluoroscope[/b] is a type of [[x-ray]] device in which the rays pass through the patient and onto a fluorescent screen, which displays a real-time x-ray image of the patient's body. This is the classic cartoon "character stands behind screen which magically reveals their bones" x-ray device, which is the form in which it's most likely to appear around here, even though the cartoon versions usually omit the actual x-ray source (which must be behind the patient for the fluoroscope to work).

Fluoroscopy was a common technique used in the early scientific investigation of x-rays, as well as their medical employment, before the dangers of continuous x-ray exposure to both patient and physician became better-known.  Modern fluoroscopes with extensive safety mechanisms are still used for some procedures (e.g., lumbar punctures) where their real-time capabilities are valuable, but for most diagnostic purposes, they have long since been supplanted by still-image radiography.

title: finn_(fire_emblem)
body:
CV: Okiayu Ryotaro (JP), Robert Clotworthy (EN)

A playable character in [[Fire Emblem: Genealogy of The Holy War]] and [[Fire Emblem: Thracia 776]].

In [i]Genealogy[/i]’s First Generation, Finn is a Knight-in-training for Leonstar’s Prince [[Quan (Fire Emblem)|]], whom he shows unwavering loyalty towards. He also becomes [[Lachesis (Fire Emblem)|]]’ bodyguard (and eventual lover) in the Oosawa Mitsuki manga adaptation.

In [i]Genealogy[/i]’s Second Generation and [i]Thracia 776[/i], a more experienced Finn serves as [[Leif (Fire Emblem)|]]’s guardian and close ally. He is also the adoptive father of [[Nanna (Fire Emblem)|]], or potentially her biological father if Finn marries Lachesis.

He has [[blue hair]] and wears a blue [[coat]] with a white [[cape]] and brown [[boots]].

h4. See Also
* [[Quan (Fire Emblem)|]], Finn’s liege
* [[Leif (Fire Emblem)|]], Quan’s son whom Finn protects.
* [[Lachesis (Fire Emblem)|]], his lover in the Oosawa manga adaptation.
* [[Nanna (Fire Emblem)|]], Finn’s adoptive daughter, can potentially be his biological daughter if he marries Lachesis.
other_names: フィン(ファイアーエムブレム)

body:
[b]Series:[/b] [[Mega Man X (series)|]]

One of the Nightmare Police from X3. Makes two cameos later in the series, first in X5's intro, then in Phoenix Magmanion's "summon past minibosses" attack in Zero 2. His Japanese name comes from Vajra, an Eastern religious reference well-known to [[God Eater]] players.

title: dynamo_(mega_man)
body:
[b]Series:[/b] [[Mega Man X (series)|]]

A side villain in the X series. A mercenary and general troublemaker, Dynamo works for Sigma in X5, and hangs around Nightmare areas in X6. He doesn't fight to the death; he's probably not even a Maverick, just a jerk.

Dynamo is unlikely to return, but remains a fan favourite. He has the distinction of being the only boss who adapts his fighting style to the character you're using (X or Zero), and in X6 he hits Zero with one of the funniest lines in the series: "You must be busy dying so many times."

title: layer_(mega_man)
body:
[b]Series:[/b] [[Mega Man X (series)|]]

One of the two new Navigators working with [[Alia (mega man)|Alia]] in X8, the other being [[pallette (mega man)|Pallette]]. Layer is a shy, busty, blushing moeblob with an obvious crush on [[Zero (mega man)|]]. Picture [[Akiyama Mio]] as a robot and you won't be far off. She has [[purple hair]] in a [[hime cut]] that [[hair over eyes|covers her eyes]], though one will pop out when she's surprised. Meanwhile, you can tell where her left eye is by the [[mole under eye|mole]] below it. (Given that she's a Reploid, these must all have been deliberate design choices.)

Layer's specialty as a Navigator is target analysis. She'll stop just short of telling you what weapon to use on bosses. As a bonus playable character, she wields a Layer Rapier and plays like Zero, right down to the special moves.

title: aphrodai_a
body:
Japanese name: アフロダイA (アフロダイエース, [i]Afurodai Ace[/i]) 
Popular English name: [b]Aphrodite A[/b]

A fictional female [[mecha]] from the [[Mazinger Z]] [[super robot]] series from the [[1970s_(style)|70s]] created by [[Nagai Gou]].

A giant female robot created by [[Doctor Yumi]] Gennosuke, with inspiration from Prof. [[Kabuto Juuzou]] 's designs. 

Unlike [[Mazinger Z (mecha)]], it was built with the weaker [i]alloy Z[/i] for the single purpose of geological research and handling of hazardous materials. As a result, it initially lacked any weapons and offensive capabilities. 

Aphrodite is piloted by Dr. Yumi's daughter [[Yumi Sayaka]]. 

It is also the first Mazinger robot and [b]first mecha in the history of anime to have a female appearance[/b].

It later introduced the [[breast_missiles|Oppai Missile System]] as its primary defensive weapons system. 

[spoilers]Destroyed by the [[robot|mechanical]] [[monster|beast]] [[Harpia Pi7]] in episode 74 of both the manga and its TV adaptation.[/spoilers]

h4. See also

* [[Dianan A]]

title: national_geographic
body:
Refers to the media franchise established by the "National Geographic Society":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Geographic_Society], an American non-profit scientific and educational organization mainly interested in geography, archaeology, and natural science, the promotion of environmental and historical conservation, and the study of world culture and history. It is known for its recognizable logo, a yellow rectangular portrait frame, which occupies the margins surrounding the front covers of the Society's "epynomous magazines":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Geographic] and also serves as its "TV channel":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Geographic_(TV_channel)] logo.

title: silver_fox_(kemono_friends)
body:
A [i][[Kemono Friends]][/i] character. She is one of many "Friends" in Japari Park, being part of the Snowy Mountain Region in the anime.

A "Silver Fox" simply refers to a melanistic (black colored) red fox with mostly black and gray fur along with a near complete lack of brown. This color morph is typical of American Red Foxes but it has spread through the fur trade. For the record, she was simply listed in the original game as an unspecified red fox ([i]Vulpes vulpes[/i]) and in the anime as an American red fox ([i]Vulpes vulpes fulvus[/i]).

Her outfit consists of what appears to be an marine blue [[blazer]] uniform with fur lined sleeves and a very short black pleated skirt worn over [[black leggings]], black gloves as well as a scarf tied into a bow. She has long dark gray hair with black-tipped bangs along with the requisite fox ears and tail. She can be distinguished from a simple palette swap of Ezo Red Fox with her long [[sidelocks]]. Her eyes are also a deeper amber color than her fellow fox.

She is sometimes depicted wearing [[glasses]] while carrying a [[flask]] due to her depiction in the original game.

She is often seen with [[ezo_red_fox_(kemono_friends)|Ezo Red Fox]], a fellow fox Friend. Compare as well with [[red_fox_(kemono_friends)|Red Fox]], their nominate species Friend.

title: victoria_cross
body:
The highest military honor awarded in the United Kingdom and various other Commonwealth countries. Known as the VC for short, it is so named because Queen Victoria instituted it in 1856 to recognize acts of bravery during the Crimean War.

Officially, it is awarded for "most conspicuous bravery, or some daring or pre-eminent act of valour or self-sacrifice, or extreme devotion to duty in the presence of the enemy" and is often personally presented by the King or Queen. Specifically, since 1857, Britain's monarch has done so more than two thirds of the time, and most of those have been at [[Buckingham Palace]]. In 1940, King George VI introduced the George Cross, which is equal in stature and awarded for "acts of the greatest heroism or of the most conspicuous courage in circumstances of extreme danger" and may also be awarded to civilians. 

H4. External Links

"Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Victoria_Cross]

title: fn_minimi
body:
The [b]FN Minimi[/b] ([i]Mini Mitrailleuse[/i]; "mini [[machine gun]]") is a 5.56×45mm NATO [b][[light machine gun]][/b] developed by Ernest Vervier for [[FN Herstal]] of Belgium, produced since 1977. The [[weapon]] uses an open-bolt, gas-actuated long-stroke piston system and a stamped metal receiver. It was adopted by the US military as the [b]M249[/B].

The Minimi Para is the more compact variant with a retractable metal stock.

title: the_rock_(movie)
body:
[b]The Rock[/b] is a 1996 action movie directed by Micheal Bay. 

The movie involves a group of rogue US Marines led by Brigadier General Frank Hummel, played by Ed Harris, who has taken over [[Alcatraz]] Island and demands the US Government compensate the families of his dead Marines who died in US black ops missions or he will launch missles armed with Nerve gas at the city of [[San Francisco]]. To stop them, [[FBI]] chemical weapons specialist, Dr. Stanley Goodspeed, played by [[Nicolas Cage]], and a former British Spy who has escaped Alcatraz in the past John Mason, played by [[Sean Connery]], join a Navy SEALs task force to infiltrate the island.

title: momo_(virgin_road)
body:
A female main character from the series [[shokei_shoujo_no_virgin_road|The Executioner and Her Way of Life]].  She is a young teen with [[pink hair]] worn up in [[twintails]] tied with [[hair ribbon]]s.

Momo is the assistant to the executioner [[Menou_(virgin_road)|]] and aids her in carrying out her duties.  Momo wears a modified priestess robe that features short frilly [[culottes]] with [[tights]]/[[pantyhose]] worn beneath it and white [[elbow gloves]] on her arms.  Her white priestess robe indicates her status as a novice and not yet fully recognized as a full priestess, while the yellow on it indicates that she belongs to no specific parish.  Her main weapon while fighting are enchanted coping saw blades.

Momo is two years younger than Menou and extremely capable.  She is infatuated with Menou, but unfortunately holds nothing but contempt for everyone else.  While Menou has to accompany [[Tokitou Akari|Akari]], Momo remains in the shadows carrying out duties for Menou.

title: tokitou_akari
body:
A female main character from the series [[shokei_shoujo_no_virgin_road|The Executioner and Her Way of Life]].  She is a Japanese first year high school student with [[short_hair|short]] [[black hair]] adorned with a white [[hairband]].  Her clothing consists of a school uniform composed of a sleeveless yellow double-breasted dress worn over a white long sleeve shirt with black cuffs adorned with a red neck ribbon, black skirt, white [[thighhighs]], and black shoes.

Akari is a "Lost One," a person isekai'd from Japan and who through the process ends up obtaining a reality breaking power attached to their soul called a "Pure Concept."   Akari's Pure Concept is "time" and her initial ability allows her to regress things to a previous state.  This ability can automatically trigger upon death and revert her body and mind back to a safe healthy state before what caused her death.

Upon meeting Menou, Akari feels that it was fate that they met and with only minor convincing by Menou ends up going along believing she will be taken somewhere safe by accompanying Menou.  Menou finds the extreme degree with which Akari trusts her to be abnormal.

title: stop_(gesture)
body:
A hand gesture in which one or both hands are fully open, with the arm(s) outstretched in front of the body, and the wrist(s) bent back at a 90 degree angle so that the fingers point upwards.

This gesture can be used to tell someone to literally stop moving forward and not come any closer to the person performing the gesture, or more figuratively to tell someone to stop doing some other action.

title: nanook_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A non-playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]].

They are an Aeon who represents Destruction. As the leader of the Antimatter Legion, they are highly considered to be the primary antagonist.

h4. Profile
[expand]
The birth of the universe is a mistake. If civilization is a growth of cancer birthed from vast stellar, then war is the only common language known to all intelligent lifeforms.

To correct the course and to rid the universe of the stain, Nanook must become the avatar of entropy.
[/expand]

title: ryouna_(senran_kagura)
body:
[[Senran Kagura]] character. A first year student at Hebijo. [[Ryoubi_(senran_kagura)|]]'s twin and elder sister.

If you're looking for someone to scold or do naughty thing to, she's your best candidate. Ryouna likes being chastised and scolded, loves showing off her [[breasts]] and is a giant [[masochism|masochist]] as seen during the course of the [[Senran Kagura Estival Versus]] installment. Pretty much any chance she gets after her sister lets it rip with expletives, aimed at her or others, she'll instantly get turned on leading to some glorious dialogue.

She has a freestyle shooting posture, has [[heterochromia|heterochromic]] eyes (one being [[green eyes|green]] and the other [[blue eyes|blue]] much like Ryoubi) and when transformed, dresses up as a princess complete with [[tiara]], [[angel wings]] and some bling. Her outfit shows off her curvy figure most of the time. Has over a dozen poses as she moves around on the field firing her guns.

Ryouna speaks in a somewhat annoying high pitched, squeaky voice, but this turns serious ranging from questioning to potentially violent if anyone mentions her deceased older sister or knows of her whereabouts.

h4. External links

* "Kagurapedia: Ryouna":[https://senrankagura.fandom.com/wiki/Ry%C5%8Dna]

title: atmospheric_perspective
body:
A technique to show distance, typically employed in large outdoor areas. It results in a reduction in contrast and clarity due to the atmosphere scattering more and more light as the distance between the object and the viewer increases. [[Haze]] can increase the intensity of the effect.

title: minna_de_mamotte_knight:_hime_no_tokemeki_rhapsody
body:
[i][b]Minna de Mamotte Knight: Hime no Tokemeki Rhapsody[/b][/i] (Japanese title: [i]みんなでまもって騎士 姫のトキメキらぷそでぃ[/i]; English title: [i]Protect Me Knight with Everyone! The Princess' Heart-throbbing Rhapsody[/i]) is the sequel to the 2010 tower defense game, [i][[Mamotte Knight]][/i], developed by Ancient and was released in 2014 for the Nintendo 3DS eShop in Japan.

The game takes place after the events of the previous game, with Princess Lola safely rescued thanks to the efforts of the four heroes and peace restored to the kingdom; however, a new threat of evil monsters known as The Four Fiends led by an evil princess has risen to plunge the kingdom into chaos. [i]Minna de Mamotte Knight[/i] expands upon its predecessor's gameplay with the inclusion of two new classes, the Old Guy and the Archer, along with the four returning classes of the previous game, adds various new character customization and RPG elements, and features the ability to create your own custom maps with its own map editor and share them via QR codes, with a story that pokes light fun at various 80's Japanese pop-culture and retro video games. It also features an optional FM synth soundtrack as downloadable content. It was localized overseas under the name [i]Gotta Protectors[/i] in 2016.

In celebration of the game's 3rd anniversary in Japan, Ancient released a freeware mini-game in 2017, [i]Minna de Mamotte Knight: Amazon no Diet Daisakusen[/i] (also known as [i]Gotta Protectors: Amazon's Running Diet[/i] in English) that can be played on  Nintendo Entertainment System emulators. It is an endless runner-styled game that is based on a reoccurring gag of the Amazon and her chubby physique as she tries to run through a forest for long as possible while collecting glass of water to stay hydrated while avoiding cupcakes along the way. It can be downloaded from the game's official Japanese website in both English and Japanese. This game would be followed up with [i]Susume!! Mamotte Knight: Hime no Totsugeki Serenade[/i] (also known as [i]Gotta Protectors: Cart of Darkness[/i] in English) in 2019.

h4. External links
* "[i]Official game website[/i]":[http://www.ancient.co.jp/~game/mamotte_knight2/]
* "[i]Official Ancient developer website[/i]":[http://www.ancient.co.jp/]
* "[i]Wikipedia article[/i]":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Protect_Me_Knight]
other_names: みんなでまもって騎士

title: ex-s_gundam
body:
Upgraded form of the [[S Gundam]] [[mobile suit]] from [[Gundam Sentinel]].

The [b]Ex-S Gundam[/b] is equipped with several new armor, weapons, and engine modules, increasing its overall performance. With these upgrades, the Ex-S Gundam has almost double the power of the original S Gundam, making it a fearsome unit indeed. 

The Ex-S Gundam is equipped with the Beam Smart Gun, INCOMs and the ALICE System, also known as [b]Advanced Logistic & In-consequence Cognizing Equipment[/b].

Piloted by [[Ryou Roots]]. Designed by [[Katoki Hajime]].

The first version of [[Cafe no Zombi-ko]], as an [[Indie Virtual Youtuber|indie]], utilizing a "Unity Store Asset":[https://assetstore.unity.com/packages/3d/characters/humanoids/humans/zombie-girl01-97923].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] and [[green eyes]]. She is wearing a [[red bowtie]], an [[open jacket|open]] [[torn jacket|torn]] [[black jacket|black]] [[blazer]], a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[torn shirt|torn]] [[white shirt]] showing [[underboob]] and [[midriff]], a [[torn skirt|torn]] [[blue skirt|blue]] [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[miniskirt]] and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[loafers]], [[blood on clothes|all]] [[blood on face|covered]] [[blood on leg|in]] [[blood on hands|blood]].

title: radiohead_(band)
body:
An English rock band formed in 1985 in Abingdon, Oxfordshire. The band consists of Thom Yorke (lead vocals, [[guitar]], [[piano]]), Jonny Greenwood (lead guitar, [[keyboard_(instrument)|keyboard]], other instruments), Ed O'Brien (guitar, backing vocals), Colin Greenwood ([[bass guitar]]), and Philip Selway ([[drum_set|drums]], percussion). 

Radiohead's music is often characterized by its experimentation with alternative rock, art rock, electronic music, and avant-garde influences. The band is known for their complex and emotionally intense songs, often dealing with themes of alienation, technology, politics, and personal relationships. 

Radiohead has released nine studio albums to date, including critically acclaimed works such as "OK Computer" (1997), "Kid A" (2000), and "In Rainbows" (2007). They are considered one of the most innovative and influential bands of their generation.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Radiohead":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/radiohead]

title: running_in_the_90's
body:
An eurobeat song recorded by Maurizio De Jorio under the alias Max Coveri.

The song was popularized by [[Initial D]] where it is used in the first race between [[Takahashi Keisuke]] ([[mazda rx-7|FD3S]]) and [[Fujiwara Takumi]] ([[toyota sprinter trueno|AE86]]).

h1. Legacy
Due to the song's appearance in Initial D, it gained it's notoriety by using in situation where someone or something is traveling in high speeds, drifting or both.
